heroContents.heroParagraph: Tired of seeing and using that old, clunky interface? Pretty U will replace it with a much more user friandly version.

sections.title: Better UI
sections.text: Pretty U injects some custom CSS and JS files in the page and uses them to improve the layout and design of the UI.

sections.title: Easier navigation
sections.text: Navigate the site easily with the new simplified navigation bar. See the full list of modificationas in the [mods page](/mods).

sections.title: Secure by default
sections.text: Pretty U only modifies the structure and look of the UI, it doesn't interfere with the page's data fetching and authentication logic.

/.FAQsParagraph: Everything you need to know about Pretty U. Can't find the answer you were looking for? Feel free to reach out to me at

faqs.a: You can install it either from the [Chrome Web Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/pretty-unipd/paliadhebikeffllmbfcpmoahogiegcf) or from [Add-ons for Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/it/firefox/addon/prettyunipd/) as you would for any other browser extension.

faqs.q: What if I use browser X?
faqs.a: Currently Pretty U is available on all [major browsers](https://gs.statcounter.com/browser-market-share/desktop/worldwide) except Safari. If your browser is [Chromium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chromium_(web_browser)) based (e.g. Brave) then you can use it.
What? Of course not. The extension was made to help myself and my fellow students navigate the intricate and sometimes outdated [unipd.it](https://unipd.it) UI.
Unfortunately no. It is available only for desktop browsers.
If you click on the extension icon a popup should appear. From there you can enable and disable Pretty U. You will have to reload the page for the change to be applied.

If something is missing or out of place you can disable the extension and reload the page. If after diong that you still see the issue, then it's a problem in the underlying page and not in Pretty U itself.
